content.description: Layback and jam the obvious, left-leaning crack.

Start by climbing into the obvious chimney to the right of

Paintbrush

. Pull onto the block to the right, and follow cracks and edges straight up to the top of the cliff. Be careful, the top is a bit loose.

Currently this is pretty dirty, but it will clean up with more traffic.

There are no fixed anchors, so the descent is down the 4th class gully between the left side and the Stripes Wall.
content.protection: Standard rack to #3 C4, heavy on the finger sizes.

content.description: Climb the converging cracks on the right side of the wall. Layback around the steep bulge at the top.

Currant Arete has fun climbing on great rock up the left arête of the aptly named Left Side Wall. The route is thin in a couple spots but is well-protected with 6 bolts. Stay on or just climber's right of the arête through a mix of face climbing and laybacking. The crux is at 40' up, pulling up to and through a small bulge.
content.location: This ascends the left arête on the Left Side Wall.

content.description: Begin all the way on the left side of the tiger wall (just left of an obvious, dark chimney).  Spot the cam placements in the roof before leaving the ground, and then crank on hero jugs to establish above the roof.  Place a couple of small but good nuts and then a small cam (new BD red X4 or BD purple C3 or equivalent) in a horizontal up to the right just before the business.  Continue up the seam to the top with good gear and good holds.
content.protection: Single rack from BD purple C3 to hand-sized with doubles in the finger-sized range and a good set of small nuts.

content.description:
Begin just to the right of an obvious dark chimney in a left-facing dihedral.  Stem, layback, and jam your way to the top.  Blue Bells shares anchors with

Currant Arete

and Thistle Crack.
content.protection: Standard single rack with doubles in the finger sizes.  BD 0.4 or equivalent places very well.
